Class ComponentCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • fonthighlightingeditor.tool.ComponentCreator

  • public class ComponentCreator
extends Object
    Factory-ish class that creates some repeatable controls used in the frame

        Creates a label containing info about a preference

      • createHashLabel

        public static JLabel createHashLabel()
        Creates a label with a hash text. This mostly exists for consistency
        Returns:
        A label containing the character "#"

      • createDisabledTextField

        public static JTextField createDisabledTextField(String preferenceName)
        Creates a disabled "text field" used to call colorChooser and show the current color selection
        Parameters:
        preferenceName - The name of the preference the field will be associated with
        Returns:
        A disabled JTextField

      • createFormattedTextField

        public static JFormattedTextField createFormattedTextField(String preferenceName,
                                                           JTextField textField)
        Creates a formatted text field used to edit the preference
        Parameters:
        preferenceName - The name of the preference the field will be associated with
        textField - A disabled JTextField associated with the preference
        Returns:
        An instantiated JFormattedTextField

      • setupMouseListener

        public static void setupMouseListener(FontHighlightingFrame frame,
                                      JTextField disabledField,
                                      processing.app.ui.ColorChooser chooser)
        Sets up a mouse listener for the disabled field
        Parameters:
        frame - The current FontHighlightingFrame instance
        disabledField - A disabled JTextField
        chooser - A ColorChooser to be triggered when the field is clicked
